Key Match Events: The Cavs wrapped up their preseason schedule with an overtime loss to the Chicago Bulls, 139-137.
Donovan Mitchell had 22 points while Darius Garland had 23.
Jarrett Allen recorded a double-double with 25 points and 16 rebounds.
Evan Mobley nearly registered a triple-double with 15 points, 10 rebounds, and 8 assists.
Dean Wade, Cleveland’s other starter in the game, also put together a solid showing with 14 points.
Post-Match Reflections: Cleveland Cavaliers head coach Kenny Atkinson expressed disappointment about the Cavs going winless in the preseason but emphasized the importance of starting fresh for the regular season.
Atkinson mentioned the need to clean some things up and be ready for game one.
